docs.lead_paragraph: The ubiquity of data gathering has staggering implications for understanding, predicting and influencing human behavior.
docs.abstract: Evgeny Morozov reviews books The Naked Future: What Happens in a World That Anticipates Your Every Move? by Patrick Tucker and Social Physics: How Good Ideas Spread--The Lessons From a New Science by Alex Pentland.

docs.lead_paragraph: As rural hospitals struggle, Georgia is letting stand-alone emergency rooms treat people in the countryside who would otherwise have to drive far away when they break an arm, need stitches or have a baby.

docs.lead_paragraph: The practice draws concern, in part, because there has been little study on the use of A.D.H.D. drugs for children under 3.

headline.main: Thousands of Toddlers Are Medicated for A.D.H.D., Report Finds, Raising Worries
headline.print_headline: Thousands of Toddlers Are Medicated for A.D.H.D., Report Finds, Raising Worries

docs.abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention data reveals that more than 10,000 American toddlers 2 or 3 years old are being medicated for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder outside established pediatric guidelines; report is among the first efforts to gauge the diagnosis of ADHD in children below age 4.
docs.snippet: The practice draws concern, in part, because there has been little study on the use of A.D.H.D. drugs for children under 3.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: In a case that raises questions about pregnant women’s rights, a woman is suing her doctors and a hospital after they overrode her decision to give birth naturally.

headline.main: Mother Accuses Doctors of Forcing a C-Section and Files Suit
headline.print_headline: Mother Accuses Doctors of Forcing a C-Section

docs.abstract: Rinat Dray is suing Staten Island University Hospital and doctors at facility for malpractice; after two cesarean sections, Dray wanted to give birth naturally but says she was pressured and threatened into another cesarean section; case forms part of debate over use of cesarean sections and raises issues about rights of pregnant women to control their own bodies.
docs.snippet: In a case that raises questions about pregnant women’s rights, a woman is suing her doctors and a hospital after they overrode her decision to give birth naturally.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Affordable Care Act has become more popular, a prominent Republican pollster says, so expect Republicans to give up talk about repealing it.

headline.main: Why G.O.P. Will Shift to Talking About Fixing the Heath-Care Law

docs.lead_paragraph: Ben Sasse of Nebraska and Tom Cotton of Arkansas are running for the Senate as common-man conservatives but share high-flying pedigrees.

headline.seo: Ben Sasse and Tom Cotton Share High-Flying Pedigrees in Senate Runs
headline.main: Ivy League Degrees, Elite Consulting Jobs, and Now Tea Party Candidacies
headline.print_headline: Ivy League Degrees, Elite Consulting Jobs, and Now Tea Party Candidacies

docs.abstract: Resumes of Ben Sasse, who won the Republican Senate primary in Nebraska, and Tom Cotton, who is challenging Democratic Sen Mark Pryor in Arkansas, do not exactly fit the profile of populists; men have a lot in common--Ivy League advanced degrees, tours in management consulting and both are running as common-man conservatives from the heartland under the banner of the Tea Party.
docs.snippet: Ben Sasse of Nebraska and Tom Cotton of Arkansas are running for the Senate as common-man conservatives but share high-flying pedigrees.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Place for Mom, a company that helps with placement in assisted living centers, now offers an online guide to the information each state provides.

headline.main: Searching for Quality in Assisted Living Care
headline.print_headline: Searching for Quality in Assisted Living Care

docs.abstract: Ann Carrns Your Money Adviser column; A Place for Mom Inc, commercial housing referral service for older adults, now offers online, state-by-state guide to obtaining records on assisted living communities; directory ranks all 50 states and District of Columbia based on ease with which consumers can gain access to inspection reports and other documents.
docs.snippet: A Place for Mom, a company that helps with placement in assisted living centers, now offers an online guide to the information each state provides.
